Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.host.models.openbmc_big_basin

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.models.openbmc_tioga_pass import OpenBMCTiogaPass

import re
import time

BASE_CMD = "ipmitool -b 9 -t 0x2c"


[docs]class BMCBigBasin(OpenBMCTiogaPass):

[docs]    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        super(BMCBigBasin, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)


    # Get sensor details from bridgeic for bigbasin

[docs]    def get_sdr_sensor_data(self):
        cmd = "sdr"
        return (self.bmc_host.run(BASE_CMD + " " + cmd, ignore_status=True))



[docs]    def get_slot_info(self):
        return "mb"



[docs]    def cycle(self, timeout=1200, post_health_check=False):
        # HEAD NODE + BIG BASIN EXPANDER OEM POWER CYCLE COMMAND
        # ipmitool raw 0x30 0xe9 0x0F
        self.run_cycle_command("dc_cycle")



[docs]    def ac_cycle(self, timeout=1200, reboot_check=True):
        #  Ac Cycle BB expander
        # ipmitool -b 9 -t 0x2c raw 0x36 0x66 0x4c 0x1c 0x00 0x0E
        self.run_cycle_command("ac_cycle")



[docs]    def run_cycle_command(self, cycle_type=None):
        # In Bigbasin and ligthening when we do cycle we got to do both on
        # expander and host
        cycle_commands = {
            "ac_cycle": {
                "host_method": super(BMCBigBasin, self).ac_cycle,
                "bb_command": "ipmitool -b 9 -t 0x2c raw 0x36 0x66 0x4c 0x1c 0x00 0x0E"
            },
            "dc_cycle": {
                "host_method": None,
                "bb_command": "ipmitool raw 0x30 0xe9 0x0F"
            },
        }

        # Collect gpu data first before running any cycle to compare it after
        # power cycle and current reboot that will be used for host_bmc health
        # check
        lspci_output = self.host.run("lspci")
        gpus = re.findall("3D controller: NVIDIA Corporation", lspci_output)
        current_reboot = self.host.get_last_reboot()

        # Run the BigBasin Expander cycle
        bb_command = cycle_commands[cycle_type]["bb_command"]
        self.bmc_host.run(bb_command)


        # Now wait for 30 secs before running the host cycle
        # This is not applicable for DC cycle , as the BigBasin DC cycle command
        # will power cycle HEAD NODE + BIG BASIN EXPANDER
        cycle_func = cycle_commands[cycle_type]["host_method"]
        if cycle_func:
            # sleep 30Sec between BB and host Cycle
            time.sleep(30)
            cycle_func(timeout=120, post_health_check=False)

        # First make sure the system is up and runing using dut_health_check
        self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, 1200)

        # Now that system is up check gpus using bigbasin bmc_health_check
        self.bmc_health_check(no_of_gpus=len(gpus))



[docs]    def bmc_health_check(self, no_of_gpus=8):
        '''
        check if the bmc is up and all GPU are populated
        '''
        time.sleep(30)
        start_time = time.time()
        timeout = 60
        success = False
        while time.time() < start_time + timeout:
            lspci_output = self.host.run("lspci")
            gpus = re.findall("3D controller: NVIDIA Corporation", lspci_output)
            if(len(gpus) == no_of_gpus):
                success = True
                break
            time.sleep(10)
        if not success:
            raise Exception("All GPUs are not powered up")
